articles.author: James Mackenzie, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israeli airstrikes had killed two successors to Hezbollah's slain leader.
articles.title: Hezbollah targets Israeli troops on Lebanese border, sirens in Beirut

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Leonara LaPeter Anton
articles.description: Hurricane Milton marched across central Florida on Thursday after making landfall on the state's west coast hours earlier, whipping up deadly tornadoes, destroying homes and knocking out power to nearly 2 million customers.
articles.title: Hurricane Milton weakens as it marches across central Florida, homes destroyed

articles.author: Steven Aristil
articles.description: Armed men launched fresh attacks on the Haitian town of Arcahaie, local media reported on Wednesday, as families mourned the growing list of victims of a massacre days earlier in an agricultural town some 60 km (37 miles) to the north.
articles.title: Haitian gangs press fresh attacks as families mourn massacre

articles.author: Simon Johnson, Justyna Pawlak
articles.description: South Korean author Han Kang won the 2024 Nobel Prize in Literature for "her intense poetic prose that confronts historical traumas and exposes the fragility of human life", the award-giving body said on Thursday.
articles.title: Han Kang of South Korea wins Nobel literature prize 2024

articles.author: Jason Lange, Bo Erickson
articles.description: Harris leads Trump among voters in the vast middle of American society by 47% to 41%.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris overtakes Trump among suburban voters, Reuters/Ipsos polling shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican senators on Thursday passed regulations stipulating how a judicial overhaul reforming the constitution will be implemented.
articles.title: Mexican Senate approves regulations on judicial reform, legislation heads to lower house

articles.author: Horacio Soria
articles.description: Argentina's triple-digit inflation, among the world's highest, is starting to slow but this offers little relief for residents whose salaries have stayed the same while costs of basic goods sky-rocketed and the government slashed state subsidies.
articles.title: Argentina's triple-digit inflation slows, but cash-strapped workers struggle to pay bills

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: A United Nations inquiry said on Thursday it found that Israel carried out a concerted policy of destroying Gaza's healthcare system in the Gaza war, actions amounting to both war crimes and the crime against humanity of extermination.
articles.title: UN inquiry accuses Israel of crime of 'extermination' in destruction of Gaza health system

articles.author: Nafisa Eltahir
articles.description: Rights activists and local responders said scores of civilians had been killed at sites across Sudan in the past week as the army escalates air strikes nearly 18 months into its war with the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces.
articles.title: Activists report spike in mass civilian deaths after Sudan's army ups airstrikes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden spoke to German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Thursday and discussed a number of topics, including the need to support Ukraine in the war against Russia, the White House said in a statement.
articles.title: Biden spoke with German chancellor, discussed Ukraine, says White House
